intro: Corispermum leptopterum, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its pale green, succulent stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically in late summer. It is adapted to arid and saline environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Corispermum leptopterum plays a role in stabilizing soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
